body: \text{Define Raoult's law and explain how it applies to ideal solutions.}

\text{Calculate the mole fraction of a solute in a solution that contains 10 g of benzene (C_6H_6) and 20 g of carbon tetrachloride (CCl_4). Given: Molar mass of C_6H_6 = 78 g/mol and CCl_4 = 154 g/mol.}
\text{Explain Henry's law and discuss its applications in real-life scenarios.}
\text{A solution is prepared by dissolving 0.5 mol of urea in 250 g of water. Calculate the molality of the solution.}
\text{Discuss the effect of temperature on the solubility of gases in liquids, with reference to Henry's law.}
\text{State and explain Kohlrausch's law of independent migration of ions.}

\text{Calculate the standard cell potential for the reaction } Zn(s) + Cu^{2+}(aq) \rightarrow Zn^{2+}(aq) + Cu(s) \text{ given } E^\circ_{Zn^{2+}/Zn} = -0.76 \; \text{V and } E^\circ_{Cu^{2+}/Cu} = 0.34 \; \text{V}.
\text{Discuss the significance of the Nernst equation and derive it for a general redox reaction.}
\text{Explain the difference between electrolytic and galvanic cells with suitable examples.}
\text{A current of 2 A flows through an electrolytic cell for 5 hours. Calculate the amount of silver deposited at the cathode. (Given: Molar mass of Ag = 108 g/mol, 1 F = 96500 C).}
\text{Define rate of reaction and derive the rate law for a first-order reaction.}
\text{A reaction is second-order with respect to a reactant A. How will the rate of reaction change if the concentration of A is doubled?}
\text{Explain the collision theory of reaction rates and its limitations.}
\text{The rate constant for a reaction is } 2.5 \times 10^{-3} \; \text{L/mol/s at 300 K. Calculate the rate of reaction when the concentration of the reactant is 0.4 M.}
\text{Derive an expression for the half-life of a first-order reaction and explain its significance.}
\text{Explain why transition metals exhibit variable oxidation states.}
\text{Describe the preparation and properties of potassium dichromate.}
\text{What is lanthanoid contraction? Explain its causes and consequences.}
\text{Discuss the uses of KMnO_4 as an oxidizing agent in acidic, basic, and neutral mediums.}
\text{Why do transition metals form colored compounds? Explain with suitable examples.}
\text{Explain Werner's theory of coordination compounds.}
\text{Define the terms ligand, coordination number, and coordination sphere with suitable examples.}
\text{Explain the difference between homoleptic and heteroleptic complexes with examples.}
\text{Describe the bonding in coordination compounds using the Valence Bond Theory (VBT).}
\text{What is crystal field theory? Explain the splitting of d-orbitals in an octahedral crystal field.}
\text{Explain the IUPAC nomenclature of haloalkanes with examples.}
\text{Describe the preparation of chlorobenzene from benzene.}
\text{Discuss the mechanism of nucleophilic substitution reactions in haloalkanes.}
\text{Explain the effect of nature of alkyl group on the reactivity of haloalkanes in nucleophilic substitution reactions.}
\text{Why are aryl halides less reactive towards nucleophilic substitution reactions than alkyl halides?}
\text{Describe the preparation of ethanol from ethene.}
\text{Explain the acidic nature of phenol and compare it with that of ethanol.}
\text{Discuss the Williamson synthesis for the preparation of ethers and provide its mechanism.}
\text{Describe the dehydration of alcohols to form alkenes and state the factors affecting the reaction.}
\text{Explain the structure and physical properties of ethers.}
\text{Explain the IUPAC nomenclature of aldehydes and ketones with examples.}
\text{Describe the mechanism of nucleophilic addition reactions in aldehydes and ketones.}
\text{Discuss the acidic nature of carboxylic acids and compare it with phenols.}
\text{Explain the aldol condensation reaction and provide an example.}
\text{Describe the preparation of acetic acid from ethanol and discuss the reagents involved.}
\text{Explain the classification of amines and give examples of each type.}
\text{Describe the Gabriel phthalimide synthesis for preparing primary amines.}
\text{Explain the basicity of amines and compare the basicity of ammonia, primary, secondary, and tertiary amines.}
\text{Discuss the Hinsberg method for distinguishing between primary, secondary, and tertiary amines.}
\text{Describe the preparation of aniline from nitrobenzene and discuss the reagents used.}
\text{Define carbohydrates and classify them with suitable examples.}
\text{Describe the structure of glucose and explain why it is classified as an aldohexose.}
\text{Explain the primary, secondary, tertiary, and quaternary structures of proteins.}
\text{Discuss the role of enzymes in biochemical reactions and describe the mechanism of enzyme action.}
\text{What are vitamins? Classify them and describe the functions of fat-soluble vitamins.}
